description: Technocrats quietly initiate a series of minor system reforms aimed at stabilizing BCI functions, influenced by behind-the-scenes consultations with trusted advisors.
Public notices gradual improvement in service access, sparking cautious optimism about the effectiveness of recent reforms.
Technocrats officially announce minor BCI upgrades designed to reduce scoring anomalies, improving citizen access to essential services.
Increased surveillance measures are implemented quietly to monitor compliance with new BCI parameters, stifling dissent within the Council.
Leaders express private concerns regarding the sustainability of minor reforms, though publicly continue to promote the achieved stability.
Stenograd citizens cautiously resume daily activities, feeling a sense of superficial stability despite underlying systemic issues remaining unresolved.
